doc: This module contains infrastructure and utility code not directly related to the application.  The contents should be considered candidates for contribution to more general packages or libraries.
base.name: base

doc: The underlying mappings are stored in a list.  That list is public and can accessed or updated using the *maps* attribute.  There is no other state.
Lookups search the underlying mappings successively until a key is found. In contrast, writes, updates, and deletions only operate on the first mapping.
ChainMap.name: ChainMap
ChainMap.summary: A ChainMap groups multiple dicts (or other mappings) together to create a single, updateable view.

new_child.summary: New ChainMap with a new map followed by all previous maps. If no map is provided, an empty dict is used.
new_child.name: new_child

update.summary: D.update([E, ]**F) -> None.  Update D from mapping/iterable E and F. If E present and has a .keys() method, does:     for k in E: D[k] = E[k] If E present and lacks .keys() method, does:     for (k, v) in E: D[k] = v In either case, this is followed by: for k, v in F.items(): D[k] = v
update.name: update

pop.summary: Remove *key* from maps[0] and return its value. Raise KeyError if *key* not in maps[0].
pop.name: pop

popitem.summary: Remove and return an item pair from maps[0]. Raise KeyError is maps[0] is empty.
popitem.name: popitem

setdefault.summary: D.setdefault(k[,d]) -> D.get(k,d), also set D[k]=d if k not in D
setdefault.name: setdefault

copy.summary: New ChainMap or subclass with a new copy of maps[0] and refs to maps[1:]
copy.name: copy

items.summary: D.items() -> a set-like object providing a view on D's items
items.name: items

values.summary: D.values() -> an object providing a view on D's values
values.name: values

keys.summary: D.keys() -> a set-like object providing a view on D's keys
keys.name: keys

modules.name: modules

SourceFileLoader.name: SourceFileLoader
SourceFileLoader.summary: Concrete implementation of SourceLoader using the file system.

doc: This method is deprecated.  Use exec_module() instead.
load_module.summary: Load a module from a file.
load_module.name: load_module

get_data.summary: Return the data from path as raw bytes.
get_data.name: get_data

doc: The 'data' argument can be any object type that compile() supports.
source_to_code.summary: Return the code object compiled from source.
source_to_code.name: source_to_code

is_package.summary: Concrete implementation of InspectLoader.is_package by checking if the path returned by get_filename has a filename of '__init__.py'.
is_package.name: is_package

get_filename.summary: Return the path to the source file as found by the finder.
get_filename.name: get_filename

path_stats.summary: Return the metadata for the path.
path_stats.name: path_stats

doc: Reading of bytecode requires path_stats to be implemented. To write bytecode, set_data must also be implemented.
get_code.name: get_code

set_data.summary: Write bytes data to a file.
set_data.name: set_data

doc: Raises IOError when the path cannot be handled.
path_mtime.summary: Optional method that returns the modification time (an int) for the specified path, where path is a str.
path_mtime.name: path_mtime

is_package_dir.summary: Returns true if 'path' is a package directory.
is_package_dir.name: is_package_dir

enumerate_package.summary: Generates subpackages and modules under a top-level package.
enumerate_package.name: enumerate_package

get_module_name_from_path.summary: Constructs the name of a module from its path relative to the import path.
get_module_name_from_path.name: get_module_name_from_path

owner.summary: Return the login name of the file owner.
owner.name: owner

as_posix.summary: Return the string representation of the path with forward (/) slashes.
as_posix.name: as_posix

doc: No normalization is done, i.e. all '.' and '..' will be kept along. Use resolve() to get the canonical path to a file.
absolute.summary: Return an absolute version of this path.  This function works even if the path doesn't point to anything.
absolute.name: absolute

lstat.summary: Like stat(), except if the path points to a symlink, the symlink's status information is returned, rather than its target's.
lstat.name: lstat

is_file.summary: Whether this path is a regular file (also True for symlinks pointing to regular files).
is_file.name: is_file

rmdir.summary: Remove this directory.  The directory must be empty.
rmdir.name: rmdir

relative_to.summary: Return the relative path to another path identified by the passed arguments.  If the operation is not possible (because this is not a subpath of the other path), raise ValueError.
relative_to.name: relative_to

unlink.summary: Remove this file or link. If the path is a directory, use rmdir() instead.
unlink.name: unlink

symlink_to.summary: Make this path a symlink pointing to the given path. Note the order of arguments (self, target) is the reverse of os.symlink's.
symlink_to.name: symlink_to

match.summary: Return True if this path matches the given pattern.
match.name: match

touch.summary: Create this file with the given access mode, if it doesn't exist.
touch.name: touch

is_socket.summary: Whether this path is a socket.
is_socket.name: is_socket

is_fifo.summary: Whether this path is a FIFO.
is_fifo.name: is_fifo

is_block_device.summary: Whether this path is a block device.
is_block_device.name: is_block_device

with_name.summary: Return a new path with the file name changed.
with_name.name: with_name

lchmod.summary: Like chmod(), except if the path points to a symlink, the symlink's permissions are changed, rather than its target's.
lchmod.name: lchmod

joinpath.summary: Combine this path with one or several arguments, and return a new path representing either a subpath (if all arguments are relative paths) or a totally different path (if one of the arguments is anchored).
joinpath.name: joinpath

_raw_open.summary: Open the file pointed by this path and return a file descriptor, as os.open() does.
_raw_open.name: _raw_open

stat.summary: Return the result of the stat() system call on this path, like os.stat() does.
stat.name: stat

rename.summary: Rename this path to the given path.
rename.name: rename

is_symlink.summary: Whether this path is a symbolic link.
is_symlink.name: is_symlink

open.summary: Open the file pointed by this path and return a file object, as the built-in open() function does.
open.name: open

as_uri.summary: Return the path as a 'file' URI.
as_uri.name: as_uri

group.summary: Return the group name of the file gid.
group.name: group

is_reserved.summary: Return True if the path contains one of the special names reserved by the system, if any.
is_reserved.name: is_reserved

glob.summary: Iterate over this subtree and yield all existing files (of any kind, including directories) matching the given pattern.
glob.name: glob

is_char_device.summary: Whether this path is a character device.
is_char_device.name: is_char_device

is_dir.summary: Whether this path is a directory.
is_dir.name: is_dir

with_suffix.summary: @todo   This hopefully will not be needed when the base method is fixed.
with_suffix.name: with_suffix

iterdir.summary: Iterate over the files in this directory.  Does not yield any result for the special paths '.' and '..'.
iterdir.name: iterdir

resolve.summary: Make the path absolute, resolving all symlinks on the way and also normalizing it (for example turning slashes into backslashes under Windows).
resolve.name: resolve

is_absolute.summary: True if the path is absolute (has both a root and, if applicable, a drive).
is_absolute.name: is_absolute

chmod.summary: Change the permissions of the path, like os.chmod().
chmod.name: chmod

rglob.summary: Recursively yield all existing files (of any kind, including directories) matching the given pattern, anywhere in this subtree.
rglob.name: rglob

replace.summary: Rename this path to the given path, clobbering the existing destination if it exists.
replace.name: replace
